Re: License #: CP730201395
Dear Jennifer Danielle Boose:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/21/2025. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency had two special evaluations completed that required CAPs.
Special Investigation 2025SIC0000330 approved 2/12/25 where agency was
found in noncompliance for Rule 400.12206-Staff Qualifications as foster care
worker made inappropriate comment to youth and pushed youth’s face in snow.
2

The approved CAP included foster care worker participating in a 6 hour Emotional
Intelligence Training and met with supervisor, and program manager to discuss
the training. Verification was provided that the agency successfully implemented
their CAP.
Special Investigation 2025SIC0000342 approved 4/18/25 where agency was
found in noncompliance for Rule 400.12214-Compliance with the Child Protection
Law as foster care worker was notified of concern regarding caregiver’s use of
marijuana and did not report it to central intake and file a DHS-3200 for
investigation. The CAP was approved 8/26/25 and included staff training related
to mandatory reporting and maintaining discussions of mandatory reporting during
monthly child welfare meetings. The CAP continues to be in active monitoring.
Chief Administrator Assessment
I reviewed the Chief Administrator Annual Assessment. The agency did not have
a CAP requirement for the renewal evaluation completed 9/3/2024. The agency
had two special evaluations completed that required a CAP. The Chief
Administrator Assessment included a review of the required corrective action
plans as well as the agency's review of key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety concern identified.
Safety Alert #1: One home was in need of two additional smoke detectors.
Resolution: The two additional detectors were installed and confirmed by a home
visit and picture verification was provided by the agency.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
10/22/2025

Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
